comments: Contribution from M. Dols (markdols99(AT)yahoo.com), May 24 2010: (Start)Infinite sum of 1/990^n with n>0. Decimal representation of sequence A000931(excluding first 3 terms):0.0010.00000.000010.0000010.00000010.000000020.0000000020.00000000030.000000000040.000000000005...............--------------- +0.001011122345..Fraction 1/1099 for sequence in reverse. (End)Generalization:  1/89 = sum (11^i/100^(i+1)), i >= 0,  1/989 = sum (11^i/1000^(i+1)), i >= 0, (this sequence)1/9989 = sum (11^i/10000^(i+1)), i >= 0, ... - _Daniel Forgues_, Oct 28 2011
